content.description: Start matched on a huge ledge with small feet. Then move up and to the right to a crimp and a great jug. Then use another good hold on the top to move up the face.
content.location: Just to the right of Dream Crusher on the slab face.

content.description: Start in the big hole near the ground and work straight up using the crack
content.location: Starts to the left of Bane of Chris

content.description: This is a fun slab problem that starts on two small ledges with tiny variations in the rock for feet. Moving up to a sidepull and then manteling onto the top of the boulder is probably the crux. We climbed it in 90 degree weather. It is probably more of a 2 when it's cold out.
content.protection: You might want a pad, but it's not that bad. Great landing.
content.location: This route is on the freestanding boulder directly in front of the Alto Standard, is right on the trail. You'll find it on the left side of the slab close to the staircase.

content.description: Sit start and work up using the variety of well-featured holds.
content.location: Not actually on the railroad boulder, but directly across the trail from it on the face of the boulder facing toward the start of the trail.

content.description: Start on Kitten's Claws and work right using the underclings and top out on Bane of Chris

Start standing with good holds and a massive pocket for a foot. Then use an undercling to reach up onto bulging face of the boulder and blindly find the crimp. Now match the crimp, hike up your feet, and then toss your left hand up to the ledge at the peak of the arete. Then get your feet up to the crimp and walk off the top.
content.location: The large overhanging bulge to the left of the slab face on the same boulder as Dream Crusher.

content.description: A neat addition right off the trail.    The obvious line traverses right  through the rail into the pocketed roof section and finishes with a good top out to the right.   It is a very obvious line, so I imagine that it has been climbed before.  Any Route name/ FA info?
content.location: The first left hand hallway encountered after carol lamb room.    Just before the stairway leading to the top of the cliff.   Starts down and to the left on an obvious low angled arete.

content.description: Large boulder located directly on the trail.
